channel.title: Stock Market Words
channel.description: Recent content on Stock Market Words

item.title: Filtered Ticker Data
item.description:
This page shows the ticker data after filtering has been applied.

Filtering Pipeline

  1. Test Issue Filter: Removes test tickers (ZZZZ, TEST, etc.)
  2. ETF Filter: Removes ETFs (common stocks only)
  3. Financial Status Filter: Removes bankrupt/deficient tickers
  4. Keyword Filter: Removes Units, Warrants, Rights, Preferred Stock
  5. Symbol Validation: Removes invalid symbols and suffixes

Pass 1: Price Extraction

After filtering, price/volume data is extracted from Yahoo Finance for all remaining tickers.

item.title: Raw FTP Data
item.description:
This page shows the raw ticker data downloaded from NASDAQ FTP servers before any filtering is applied.

Data Sources

  • nasdaqlisted.txt: All NASDAQ-listed securities
  • otherlisted.txt: Securities listed on other exchanges (NYSE, AMEX, etc.)

The data includes test tickers, ETFs, warrants, units, preferred stock, and all other security types.

item.title: ğŸ‹ Institutional Whale Strategy
item.description:
What is this strategy?

For investors who want to “follow the smart money” - targeting large, institutional-quality companies.

This strategy focuses on large-cap stocks (market cap > $10 billion) that institutional investors like pension funds, mutual funds, and hedge funds typically hold. These are stable, liquid, well-researched companies.

Filter Criteria

market_cap > 10000000000

In plain English: We’re looking for stocks that:

  • Have market capitalization exceeding $10 billion (large-cap threshold)
  • Are liquid enough for institutional-sized positions
  • Typically have analyst coverage and financial transparency
  • Represent established, proven business models

Strategy Score: Larger market cap earns higher scores. Mega-caps get preferential treatment.

item.title: ğŸ’° Dividend Daddy Strategy
item.description:
What is this strategy?

For income-focused investors seeking steady, reliable returns with lower risk.

This strategy identifies stocks that pay attractive dividends while maintaining relatively stable prices (low beta/volatility). Think established companies with consistent cash flow that reward shareholders through regular dividend payments.

Filter Criteria

dividend_yield > 0 AND has_ma200_data

In plain English: We’re looking for stocks that:

  • Pay dividends (any positive yield)
  • Have at least 200 days of trading history
  • Are trading at reasonable prices and volumes (our base filters)

Strategy Score: Higher dividend yields and lower beta (volatility) earn higher scores. A stock with 5% yield and beta of 0.8 scores better than one with 2% yield and beta of 1.5.

item.title: ğŸ“ˆ Over Hyped Strategy
item.description:
What is this strategy?

For short sellers and traders expecting mean reversion - identifying overextended stocks due for a pullback.

This strategy finds overbought stocks (high RSI) that have run up too far, too fast. When RSI exceeds 70, it suggests buying exhaustion and potential reversal. Great for short positions or waiting to buy after a dip.

Filter Criteria

rsi > 70

In plain English: We’re looking for stocks that:

  • Are overbought (RSI > 70 = recent heavy buying, potentially overdone)
  • Have strong recent momentum that may be unsustainable
  • Could see profit-taking or pullback as momentum fades

Strategy Score: Higher RSI earns higher scores. More overbought = riper for reversal.

item.title: ğŸ”ª Falling Knife Strategy
item.description:
What is this strategy?

For contrarian investors who “catch falling knives” - buying beaten-down stocks with potential for rebound.

This strategy finds oversold stocks (low RSI) trading BELOW their 200-day moving average. The classic contrarian play: when others are fearful and selling, you’re buying the dip, betting on mean reversion.

Filter Criteria

rsi < 30 AND price < ma200

In plain English: We’re looking for stocks that:

  • Are deeply oversold (RSI < 30 = recent heavy selling pressure)
  • Are trading BELOW their 200-day average price (technical support level)
  • Have fallen significantly, creating potential bounce-back opportunity

Strategy Score: Lower RSI and bigger gap below MA-200 earn higher scores. More oversold stocks trading further below their average score better.

item.title: ğŸš€ Moon Shot Strategy
item.description:
What is this strategy?

For aggressive investors seeking explosive growth potential and willing to accept high volatility.

This strategy targets stocks with high beta (volatile, reactive to market swings) that are currently showing momentum. Think growth stocks with high volatility - “catch them before they rocket.”

Filter Criteria

beta > 1.5 AND rsi < 70

In plain English: We’re looking for stocks that:

  • Move MORE than the market (beta > 1.5 means 50%+ more volatile)
  • Have room to run (RSI < 70 means not yet overbought)
  • Have strong momentum potential for rapid gains

Strategy Score: Higher beta combined with lower RSI earns better scores. More volatile stocks with more room to grow score higher.

item.title: About
item.description:
Stock Market Words: A Ticker Discovery Tool

Stock Market Words is a playful experiment that finds valid stock ticker symbols hidden in everyday English words and text.

What Does It Do?

  1. Ticker Extraction Tool (Homepage): Paste any text and our algorithm will extract stock tickers using a word-consuming backtracking search. It shows you 5 different portfolio strategies, each optimized for different investment goals:

    • ğŸ’° Dividend Daddy: High dividend yield + low volatility stocks
    • ğŸš€ Moon Shot: High growth potential (high beta + oversold)
    • ğŸ”ª Falling Knife: Contrarian plays (oversold + below moving average)
    • ğŸˆ Over-Hyped: Overbought stocks (potential short candidates)
    • ğŸ‹ Institutional Whale: Large-cap stocks with institutional backing

  2. Filtered Data View: Browse all ~5,400+ filtered common stocks with price data, sortable and filterable by exchange.

item.title: Data Sets
item.description:
Data Sets

View the different data sets used by the Stock Market Words ticker extraction tool.

Raw Data

  • Raw FTP Data - Direct downloads from NASDAQ FTP (unprocessed)
  • Filtered Tickers - Cleaned and filtered dataset (5,444 tickers)

Strategy-Specific Data

Each strategy uses pre-filtered tickers that match specific investment criteria:

  • ğŸ’° Dividend Daddy - High yield dividend stocks
  • ğŸš€ Moon Shot - High beta growth stocks
  • ğŸ”ª Falling Knife - Oversold value opportunities
  • ğŸˆ Over-Hyped - Overbought momentum plays
  • ğŸ‹ Institutional Whale - Large cap institutional favorites

item.title: Investment Strategies
item.description:
Investment Strategies

The Stock Market Words tool uses 5 different investment strategies to analyze and rank stock tickers found in your text.

Available Strategies

ğŸ’° Dividend Daddy

Focus: High yield + low volatility
Best for: Income-focused, conservative investors

Finds stocks with high dividend yields and low volatility (beta). Ideal for investors seeking steady, passive income with minimal price swings.

Best for: Aggressive growth seekers
